item.title: D:d Ratio
item.description: gimmick: math D:d Ratio Notes & Use Calculates: D:d ratios for given pulley and cable sizes Adjusted capacity of wire rope due to D:d bend Note: that at a D:d ratio of 10 and less, permanent distortions of the rope will occur. (This is a general rule of thumb, different construction ropes will vary.) Figure Terms Dtread= Tread diameter, inches Dcable= Cable diameter, inches Equations Pitch Diameter, inches: $$ D_{pitch} = D_{tread} + D_{cable}$$

item.title: Fleet Angle
item.description: gimmick: math Fleet Angle Notes & Use Calculates the allowable offset distance and distance from a pulley or drum with respect to an included angle. This calculator will calculate for all three variables by way of a user-selected drop down menu. Figure Terms d = Offset distance, units of length D = Distance from pulley or drum, units of length φ = included angle, degrees Equations $$ \phi = atan , \left( \frac {d}{D} \right) $$

item.title: Frustum
item.description: gimmick: math Conical Frustum Flattener Notes & Use This calculator calculates the flat pattern for a right-angle conical frustum. Figure Terms r' = Top radius of conical frustum, units of length R = Bottom radius of conical frustum, units of length h = height of conical frustum, units of length φ = included angle of conical frustum, radians s' = Flattened small radius, units of length S = Flattened large radius, units of length
